page.title: 04See Boughton near Kettering
page.content:
The advertising literature boasts every facility for a family day out and those of us who have been agree.
There is a picnic area, an adventure woodland play area, nature trails, a garden shop and a newly restored stables display area with an 1825 family coach. Teas are available and there are wheelchair facilities for the disabled.
Car and coach parking is free but admission charges are made to both the House and grounds.
Some 22,000 people visited the House and grounds in 1984. During the 1985 season the grounds and House were open to the public in April and then from August through to October on certain days.
